Class GridViewAdapterAchievements

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<ItemAchievementViewHolder>
      • com.mad.p03.np2020.routine.Focus.Adapter.GridViewAdapterAchievements

  • public class GridViewAdapterAchievements
extends androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<ItemAchievementViewHolder>
    This adapter is used to display the gridviewAdpater Achievments bind to ItemAchievmentViewholder user is allowed to click on the item to show the details of the badge and share to Instagram
    Since:
    01-08-2020

public ItemAchievementViewHolder onCreateViewHolder(@NonNull

        onCreateViewHolder in class androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<ItemAchievementViewHolder>
        Parameters:
        parent - The ViewGroup is the parent view that will hold your cell that you are about to create. So, the ViewGroup parent is the RecyclerView here (it will hold your cell). The parent is used during the layout inflation process so you can see it passed in to the inflate call.
        viewType - The viewType is useful if you have different types of cells in your list. For example, if you have a header cell and a detail cell. You can use the viewType to make sure that you inflate the correct layout file for each of those two types of cells.
        Returns:
        return the Viewholder that is created within the onCreateViewHolder method
